intro: Odontarrhena granatensis, commonly known as the granate odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing adaptability to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, providing a drought-resistant feature. Odontarrhena granatensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
